Detailed Description

Structure to hold a quaternion.

A normalised quaternion to represent a rotation in 3D about an arbitrary axis

const Real &  _y = 0,

_w - initial value of Quaternion::w

Member Function Documentation

Quaternion chain::Quaternion::Conjugate (  )  const

Calculate the conjugate of this quaternion.

This is equvilent to the inverse of a normalised quaternion and therefore opposite rotation to that defined by this quaternion

Returns:
chain::Quaternion - conjugate of this quaternion

Calculate quaternion's magnitude.

Not-equal comparison operation, using FCOMPARE()

chain::Quaternion chain::Quaternion::operator* ( const Real &  r  )  const

Multiply a quaternion. This uses SLERP()

chain::Quaternion chain::Quaternion::operator* ( const Quaternion &  q  )  const

Multiply two quaternions. With normalised rotation quaternions, this can be seen to be similar to vector addition. Multiplication by the inverse quaternion would then be equivalent to vector subtraction

chain::Quaternion chain::Quaternion::operator- (  )  const

Get the inverse of this quaternion.

This uses Conjugate()

Returns:
chain::Quaternion -
Warning:
The quaternion is assumed to be normalised.

const Quaternion & chain::Quaternion::SetAxisAngle ( const Real &  angle,
const Real &  _x,
const Real &  _y,
const Real &  _z 
)

Set the value of the rotation using an axis angle.

Axis angle is defined by a axis to rotate about (_x, _y, _z), and the angle to rotate by

Parameters:
angle - angle to be rotated (in radians)
_x - x component of axis
_y - y component of axis
_z - z component of axis
Returns:
const Quaternion& - this quaternion
See also:
ToAxisAngles()

void chain::Quaternion::Split ( Quaternion &  _x,
Quaternion &  _y,
Quaternion &  _z 
) const

Split quaternion rotation into component rotations.

Split into roll, pitch, yaw (rotations about x, y, and z axis respectively).

recombined in this order:
R = _z * _y * _x
Parameters:
[out] _x - x-axis rotation
[out] _y - y-axis rotation
[out] _z - z-axis rotation

void chain::Quaternion::ToAxisAngles ( Real &  angle,
Real &  _x,
Real &  _y,
Real &  _z 
) const

Convert quaternion to a axis angle.

Axis angle is defined by a axis to rotate about (_x, _y, _z), and the angle to rotate by

Parameters:
[out] angle - angle rotated by (in radians)
[out] _x - x component of axis
[out] _y - y component of axis
[out] _z - z component of axis
See also:
SetAxisAngle()

chain::EulerAngle chain::Quaternion::ToEulerAngles (  )  const

Convert quaternion to euler angles.

Returns:
EulerAngle - result euler angle
Warning:
Euler angle rotation is not equivalent to quaternion rotation.
See also:
EulerAngle EulerAngle::FromQuat()

chain::Matrix chain::Quaternion::ToMatrix (  )  const

Convert quaternion to a rotation matrix.

Returns:
Matrix - result matrix

Bug:
This is in the incorrect format! Should be transposed

Friends And Related Function Documentation

Quaternion DIFF ( const Quaternion &  orig,
const Quaternion &  dest 
) [friend]

Get the difference between two quaternions.

Calculate the rotation between two normalised quaternion rotations. This is the same as q1 * (-q2)

Parameters:
orig - First rotation
dest - Second rotation
Returns:
Quaternion - result quaternion
See also:
Quaternion::operator*()

Real chain::Quaternion::m_data[4]

Array data interface.

Array to access all four values

Real chain::Quaternion::w

Fourth value, the scalar rotation element

First value, x axis component

Real chain::Quaternion::y

Second value, y axis component

Third value, z axis component
